channel.title: BSOD and HL2 Crashes
channel.description: Hello, I have a problem with Black Mesa, after some tome of playing (like 7 minutes) this game freezes my computer and then a get BSOD. With this issue the game is almost unplayable. My PC Specs (it´s laptop): OS - Win 7 Home Premium, 64-bit, SP 1 CPU: Intel Core I7-26300QM GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GT 540M RAM: 8 GB (4+4) Drivers are up-to-date, my system is [b]not [/b]overheating (maximal tempurature was around 80°C) Driver for GT 540M is 306.97 (I used the "clean installation" option to update) Any other applications on source engine are working properly (CSS, Portal) Unfortunately when i get BSOD the Black Mesa doesn´t create the dump file so I´am posting some previous minidump when only HL2 stopped working and screenshot, because the whole win7 dump file is too large (over 500MB). I was looking forward to play remake of the legendary Half-Life, but this makes me really upset. Sorry for my bad English. Thanks for any advice. ![Windows7-crash.jpg|498x280](upload://pyx3gyyk2kliP4A38NSKL5ZZ4oe.jpeg) hl2_4104_crash_2012_10_23T18_41_14C0.mdmp (111 KB)

item.title: BSOD and HL2 Crashes
item.dc:creator: mirece
item.description:
I just manually replaced the nvlddmkm.sys from Nvidia folder to drivers folder in windows/system32/drivers.

So finally I was able to beat whole game. Thx and keep working on thee next part XD.

item.title: BSOD and HL2 Crashes
item.dc:creator: mirece
item.description:
Hello,

I have a problem with Black Mesa, after some tome of playing (like 7 minutes) this game freezes my computer and then a get BSOD. With this issue the game is almost unplayable.

My PC Specs (it´s laptop):
OS - Win 7 Home Premium, 64-bit, SP 1
CPU: Intel Core I7-26300QM
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GT 540M
RAM: 8 GB (4+4)

Drivers are up-to-date, my system is not overheating (maximal tempurature was around 80°C)
Driver for GT 540M is 306.97 (I used the “clean installation” option to update)

Any other applications on source engine are working properly (CSS, Portal)

Unfortunately when i get BSOD the Black Mesa doesn´t create the dump file so I´am posting some previous minidump when only HL2 stopped working and screenshot, because the whole win7 dump file is too large (over 500MB).

I was looking forward to play remake of the legendary Half-Life, but this makes me really upset. Sorry for my bad English. Thanks for any advice.
